com.model.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.model.entity.Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameCharacter

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    An entity in the game world. This includes everything that could be found or placed in a room, but not elements of the dungeon itself.
    Author:
    Christopher

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity(java.lang.String name)
      Creates an Entity with the given name that does not send notifications.
      Entity(java.lang.String name, GUI view)
      Creates an Entity with the given name that will send notifications to the given GUI.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(java.lang.String name)
        Creates an Entity with the given name that does not send notifications.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the entity. Should be human readable.

      • Entity

        public Entity(java.lang.String name,
              GUI view)
        Creates an Entity with the given name that will send notifications to the given GUI.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the entity. Should be human readable.
        view - The GUI to send messages to.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the name of the entity.

      • die

        public void die(Entity source)
        Kills off the entity, potentially removing it from the game. The entity responsible has its registerKill method called. This implementation of this method only calls registerKill.
        Parameters:
        source - entity responsible for the death.

      • registerKill

        public void registerKill(Entity target)
        Registers killing off an entity. Aautomatically called by the die method. Default implementation of this method is empty.
        Parameters:
        target - entity killed off by this entity.

      • setView

        public void setView(GUI view)
        Sets the output view to send notifications to. Notifications and events will be send to this GUI.
        Parameters:
        view - view to send messages to

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns:
        whether or not this character is considered dead.
